jena_functions

Class fuseki_connector

  • java.lang.Object
    • jena_functions.fuseki_connector

  • public class fuseki_connector
extends java.lang.Object
    This class builds a connection to the Fuseki-Server. The default URL to the main-page of the Fuseki-Server is "localhost:3030". Open a browser, type in the URL and go to "Control Panel" and select your dataset to access RDF-Files and RDF-models. This is the place where RDF will be stored and where you can execute Queries or upload RDF-files.
    Author:
    Dilek R.

    • Constructor Detail

      • fuseki_connector

        public fuseki_connector(java.lang.String dataset,
                        java.lang.String page_dir_path,
                        java.lang.String log_property_path)
                 throws NoPagesDirException
        This is a constructor to access the fuseki-server.
        Parameters:
        dataset - This is a temporary path of the location where you will find datasets. Set it to "/ds" if you don't know what to add here.
        page_dir_path - This is the path of the directory "pages" which is located in your fuseki-api.
        log_property_path - The path of the log4j.properties which is located in your fuseki_api.
        Throws:
        NoPagesDirException - Throw an exception in case of wrong pages directory.

        public com.hp.hpl.jena.query.DatasetAccessor getAccessor()
                                                  throws NoDatasetAccessorException
        This method returns an Accessor for your RDF-files.
        Returns:
        ds_accessor Accessor for your RDF-files or RDF-models
        Throws:
        NoDatasetAccessorException - Throws an Exception if no data-accessor found.

      • getServerConf

        public org.apache.jena.fuseki.server.ServerConfig getServerConf()
        This method will give you the current configurations of the fuseki-server.
        Returns:
        server_conf Configuration file of fuseki-server.

      • getDatasetGraph

        public com.hp.hpl.jena.sparql.core.DatasetGraph getDatasetGraph()
        This method returns the DatasetGraph of the fuseki-server (location of your RDF-files etc.)
        Returns:
        ds_graph Default dataset-graph.

      • start

        public void start()
           throws NoDatasetGraphException,
                  NoServerConfigException
        This method starts the fuseki-server until it is being stopped.
        Throws:
        NoDatasetGraphException - throws an exception if no dataset-graph found.
        NoServerConfigException - throws an exception if no server-configuration file found.
